title: Dancers, Entrance on Stage
credit_line: Acquired through the generosity of the Sarah Mellon Scaife Family
provenance_text:
Hilaire-Germain-Edgar Degas [1834-1917], until 1917; his estate, Atelier Degas, Paris, France, September 1917 until May 1918; sale, Galerie Georges Petit, Paris, France, May 6, 1918 until May 8, 1918, no. 209 [1]; purchased by Durand-Ruel and Ambroise Vollard, Paris, France [2]. Max Pellequer [d. 1974], Paris, France [3]; Sam Salz [1894-1981], Inc., New York, NY, by 1966; purchased by Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1966. 

Notes:
[1]. This was the first sale of Atelier Degas. The work was illustrated in the catalogue.
[2]. Durand-Ruel stock no. D12731 and Ambroise Vollard stock number 1CS23, 8100 F. 
[3]. Purchased after World War I, according to information from Sam Salz in curatorial file.
